greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q^(1/4) * (eta(q^8) * eta(q^10) + eta(q^2) * eta(q^40)) / (eta(q^4) * eta(q^20)) in powers of q.
comment: Denoted by "(160~b)" in Simon Norton's replicable function list.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (1280 t)) = f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (QPochhammer[ x^8] QPochhammer[ x^10] + x QPochhammer[ x^2] QPochhammer[ x^40]) / (QPochhammer[ x^4] QPochhammer[ x^20]), {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Sep 06 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x^8 + A) * eta(x^10 + A) + x * eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^40 + A)) / (eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^20 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Oct 17 2008, Nov 11 2008, Jan 21 2009
